description: Maldives bans "all and any excursion activities within the Greater Male Region, until further notice"

The Director General of Public Health, Maldives on April 15, 2020 issued a notice that all individuals are to stay home for a period of  24 hours which was later extended to April 16, 2020 for another 24 hours.

Members of the Maldives Police Service and Maldives National Defense Force, Health professionals, and individuals and media staff provided with a special pass from the National Emergency Operations Centre are exempted.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Authorities of Maldives to place the Greater Malé area under lockdown for further 24 hours as of April 16 to prevent the spread of coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
Authorities of Maldives to place the Greater Malé area under lockdown for further 24 hours as of April 16 to prevent the spread of coronavirus disease (COVID-19).

The Director General of Public Health, Maldives on April 15, 2020 issued a notice that all individuals are to stay home for a period of  24 hours which was later extended to April 16, 2020 for another 24 hours.

Members of the Maldives Police Service and Maldives National Defense Force, Health professionals, and individuals and media staff provided with a special pass from the National Emergency Operations Centre are exempted.

The lock down has been extended since April 16th, through two extension notices, until May 28th, 2020. UPDATE: The lock down period was extended until My 28th, 2020, by the Health Protection Agency.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Authorities of Maldives to place the Greater Malé area under lockdown for further 24 hours as of April 16 to prevent the spread of coronavirus disease (COVID-19). UPDATE: The original lockdown was set to last until April 17, it has been extended to April 30. The Maldivian government extends the lockdown imposed in the Greater Male region for 14 days on April 17.
Maldivian authorities announced on Wednesday, April 29, that the 24-hour lockdown in the Greater Male region will be extended for a further 14 days from Thursday, April 30.
As of November 7, 2020, Authorities of Maldives shorten Greater Male’s curfew hours and ease other COVID-19 measures.
